content: a hug twisted slip_stitch scarf by designer charissa clark howe i have been a youth leader at my church for several years and recently i was having a conversation with a student who i d had that was now in her second year of college she was having a rough semester and made the comment i really need a hug but there s noone here to hug so i knit her a hug to wear whenever she needs one skill level slightly more than brand new beginner + basic crochet knowledge supplies 2 skeins lion brand vanna s choice 100% acrylic in color of choice for main color i used 1 skein each lion brand vanna s choice 100% acrylic in two contrast colors i used size us 8 needles size j crochet hook guage 3 st/inch in stockingette stitch scarf co 46 st knit 3 row garter stitch row 1 mc k3 *k1 s1kw* repeat between * until 3 st rem k3 row 2 k3 p until 3 st rem k3 row 3 cc1 k3 *k1 s1kw* repeat between * until 3 st rem k3 row 4 k3 p until 3 st rem k3 row 5 cc2 k3 *k1 s1kw* repeat between * until 3 st rem k3 row 6 k3 p until 3 st rem k3 repeat row 1-6 to desired length edging fold scarf in half long-wise with a size j crochet hook and mc join and single_crochet through both layers of scarf at corner * single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet into next row end single_crochet into next row end* across length of scarf finishing add fringe to end if desired i don t usually go for fringe but i think it really works with this scarf abbreviations co cast on st s stitch es k knit bobble bind off p purl mc main color cc1 contrast color 1 cc2 contrast color 2 gs garter stitch working in the flat knit every row rem remains single_crochet single_crochet chain chain s1kw slip 1 stitch knitwise 2007 all rights reserved charissa clark howe pattern rev 12/06/07 http //www howe2knit blogspot com
